016package edu.cnm.deepdive.rps.view;
017
018import android.content.Context;
019import android.graphics.Canvas;
020import android.graphics.Color;
021import android.graphics.Paint;
022import android.util.AttributeSet;
023import android.view.View;
024import androidx.annotation.NonNull;
025import androidx.annotation.Nullable;
026import java.util.stream.IntStream;
027
028/**
029 * Custom view that renders the terrain of an intransitive ecosystem (e.g. Rock-Paper-Scissors) as a
030 * lattice or grid. All cells in the grid are occupied by members of the competing breeds, and each
031 * is displayed as a circle filled with a color specific to that breed.
032 */
033public class TerrainView extends View {
034
035  private static final float COLOR_SATURATION = 1f;
036  private static final float COLOR_VALUE = 1f;
037
038  private int numBreeds;
039  private Paint[] breedPaints;
040  private int[][] terrain;
041
042  /**
043   * Chains to the corresponding superclass constructor to initialize the inherited state.
044   *
045   * @param context Android context in which this instance is created.
046   */
047  public TerrainView(Context context) {
048    super(context);
049  }
050
051  /**
052   * Chains to the corresponding superclass constructor to initialize the inherited state.
053   *
054   * @param context Android context in which this instance is created.
055   * @param attrs Layout attributes.
056   */
057  public TerrainView(Context context, @Nullable AttributeSet attrs) {
058    super(context, attrs);
059  }
060
061  /**
062   * Chains to the corresponding superclass constructor to initialize the inherited state.
063   *
064   * @param context Android context in which this instance is created.
065   * @param attrs Layout attributes.
066   * @param defStyleAttr Style attributes.
067   */
068  public TerrainView(Context context, @Nullable AttributeSet attrs, int defStyleAttr) {
069    super(context, attrs, defStyleAttr);
070  }
071
072  /**
073   * Chains to the corresponding superclass constructor to initialize the inherited state.
074   *
075   * @param context Android context in which this instance is created.
076   * @param attrs Layout attributes.
077   * @param defStyleAttr Style attributes.
078   * @param defStyleRes Style resource.
079   */
080  public TerrainView(Context context, @Nullable AttributeSet attrs, int defStyleAttr,
081      int defStyleRes) {
082    super(context, attrs, defStyleAttr, defStyleRes);
083  }
084
085  /**
086   * Computes the dimensions of this instance, setting them to be those of the largest square that
087   * conforms to the values of the {@code android:layout_width} and {@code android:layout_height}
088   * attributes set in the layout.
089   *
090   * @param widthMeasureSpec  horizontal space requirements as imposed by the parent. The
091   *                          requirements are encoded with {@link android.view.View.MeasureSpec}.
092   * @param heightMeasureSpec vertical space requirements as imposed by the parent. The requirements
093   *                          are encoded with {@link android.view.View.MeasureSpec}.
094   */
095  @Override
096  protected void onMeasure(int widthMeasureSpec, int heightMeasureSpec) {
097    int width = getSuggestedMinimumWidth();
098    int height = getSuggestedMinimumHeight();
099    width =
100        resolveSizeAndState(getPaddingLeft() + getPaddingRight() + width, widthMeasureSpec, 0);
101    height =
102        resolveSizeAndState(getPaddingTop() + getPaddingBottom() + height, heightMeasureSpec, 0);
103    int size = Math.max(width, height);
104    setMeasuredDimension(size, size);
105  }
106
107  /**
108   * Iterates over the terrain (specified as an argument to {@link #setTerrain(int[][])}, rendering
109   * its contents to the {@code canvas}. Each row of the terrain array is rendered as a row of
110   * circles, squares, or rounded rectangles, each drawn with the {@link Paint} instance
111   * corresponding to the breed number of the corresponding element in the terrain.
112   *
113   * @param canvas Drawing surface.
114   */
115  @Override
116  protected void onDraw(@NonNull Canvas canvas) {
117    super.onDraw(canvas);
118
119    // TODO Do the following ONLY IF neither terrain nor breedPaints is null. THIS IS IMPORTANT!
120
121      // TODO Declare and initialize a float variable to hold the size of the individual ovals to be
122      //  drawn. To compute the value assigned to this variable:
123      //  1. Get the width (or height) of this view with getWidth() (or getHeight()),
124      //  2. Get the number of rows (or columns) in the terrain using terrain.length (or
125      //     terrain[0].length).
126      //  3. Divide the value from #1 by the value from #2. IMPORTANT: Cast the numerator or
127      //     denominator to float, so that the division will be done using floating-point
128      //     arithmetic. For example, you might use (float) getHeight() / terrain.length.
129      //  4. Assign the division result to the variable.
130
131      // TODO Iterate over all of the rows and columns of terrain, using a traditional for loop
132      //  (that is, with a row index and a column index). For each element, use canvas.drawOval to
133      //  draw an oval for the current element of terrain.
134      //  - The x coordinate of the left side of the oval can be computed by multiplying the oval
135      //    size (above) with the current column index.
136      //  - The x coordinate of the right side of the oval can be computed by multiplying the oval
137      //    size (above) and (1 + column index); that is, the x coordinate of the right side of the
138      //    oval is the same as the x coordinate of the left side of any oval in the next column to
139      //    the right.
140      //  - The y coordinate of the top of the oval can be computed by multiplying the oval size
141      //    (above) and the current row index.
142      //  - The y coordinate of the bottom of the oval can be computed by multiplying the oval size
143      //    (above) and (1 + row index); that is, the y coordinate of the right side of the oval
144      //    is the same as the y coordinate of the top of any oval in the next row down.
145      //  - The Paint instance can be obtained from the breedPaints array, at the position
146      //    corresponding to the terrain element value. For example, if the value of terrain at the
147      //    current row and column index positions is 5, you would use the Paint instance found in
148      //    breedPaints[5]).
149
150      // TODO STRETCH GOAL: If the computed size of each oval is less than a threshold size of 20,
151      //  draw rectangles (squares, in this case) instead of ovals (circles). However, do this
152      //  WITHOUT including an if statement inside the loop. (Hint: Think about a lambda.)
153
154  }
155
156  /**
157   * Constructs an array of {@link Paint} instances with a length equal to {@code numBreeds}. The
158   * instance at a given position in of the array will be used when drawing each individual of the
159   * breed identified by the same number as that position. For example, the {@link Paint} instance
160   * in position 2 will be used to draw all members of breed 2 in the grid.
161   * <p>All of the color values in the array are specified using the Hue-Saturation-Value (HSV)
162   * color model: all have the same saturation and value, while the hues are distributed evenly
163   * around the 360&#176; of the color wheel, {@code (360 / numBreeds)}&#176; apart.</p>
164   *
165   * @param numBreeds Initial number of competing breeds in the ecosystem.
166   */
167  public void setNumBreeds(int numBreeds) {
168    float colorWidth = 360f / numBreeds;
169    breedPaints = IntStream.range(0, numBreeds)
170        .mapToObj((breed) -> {
171          Paint paint = new Paint();
172          paint.setColor(
173              Color.HSVToColor(new float[]{colorWidth * breed, COLOR_SATURATION, COLOR_VALUE}));
174          return paint;
175        })
176        .toArray(Paint[]::new);
177  }
178
179  /**
180   * Sets the {@code int[][]} terrain to be rendered, as described in {@link #onDraw(Canvas)}. The
181   * value of each element in the terrain is the breed number of the individual occupying that
182   * position in the terrain.
183   *
184   * @param terrain {@code int[][]} to be rendered.
185   */
186  public void setTerrain(int[][] terrain) {
187    this.terrain = terrain;
188  }
189
190}
